synsets.definition: The state of being regarded as within normal social parameters without particular distinction or disfavor; meeting baseline expectations of social propriety
synsets.cultural_note: In Chinese culture, being 'zhengchang' represents acceptable social positioning without losing or gaining face - a neutral maintenance of social equilibrium

synsets.definition: Social recognition that acknowledges one's presence within the group without disrupting wa (harmony) or creating obligation
synsets.cultural_note: In Japanese social context, 'futsuu' regard allows individuals to exist within collective harmony without standing out positively or negatively

synsets.definition: Social acknowledgment that neither enhances nor diminishes one's position within the complex web of hierarchical relationships
synsets.cultural_note: Korean 'pyeongbeom' represents a neutral social state that doesn't activate jeong (emotional bonds) or trigger hierarchical adjustments

synsets.definition: Recognition of one's dharmic position without judgment of merit or demerit in fulfilling social duties
synsets.cultural_note: In Hindu social philosophy, 'samanya' regard acknowledges one's role without karmic implications of praise or censure

synsets.definition: Social recognition that falls within expected norms of community interaction without invoking special consideration or concern
synsets.cultural_note: In Arab culture, 'aadi' regard maintains social equilibrium within the complex honor-shame spectrum without activation

synsets.definition: Acknowledgment of one's social presence that doesn't require kreng jai (considerate restraint) or special social maneuvering
synsets.cultural_note: Thai 'thammada' represents baseline social recognition that doesn't activate the complex web of social obligations and considerations

synsets.definition: Social acknowledgment that operates within standard taarof protocols without requiring elevated or diminished courtesy
synsets.cultural_note: In Persian culture, 'maamuli' regard functions within normal social etiquette without triggering elaborate courtesy rituals

synsets.definition: Community acknowledgment that maintains social fabric without invoking ubuntu obligations or communal judgment
synsets.cultural_note: In East African contexts, 'kawaida' recognition preserves community harmony without activating deeper ubuntu responsibilities

synsets.definition: Social recognition within community that doesn't trigger gotong royong obligations or communal mobilization
synsets.cultural_note: Indonesian 'biasa' acknowledgment exists within community without activating collective cooperation mechanisms

synsets.definition: Social regard that maintains harmonious coexistence without disrupting ancestral honor or family reputation
synsets.cultural_note: Vietnamese concept emphasizing maintenance of social equilibrium within extended family and community honor systems

synsets.definition: Recognition within the community that doesn't affect kapwa (shared identity) dynamics or utang na loob (debt of gratitude) relationships
synsets.cultural_note: Filipino 'karaniwan' operates within complex social reciprocity systems without creating obligation or debt

synsets.definition: Community acknowledgment that places one among the general social body without special distinction or concern
synsets.cultural_note: Ethiopian concept reflecting communal recognition that doesn't distinguish individuals from the collective social fabric

synsets.definition: Social recognition that exists within community without invoking ancestral attention or spiritual significance
synsets.cultural_note: Yoruba concept of acknowledgment that doesn't disturb the spiritual-social balance or require ritual consideration

synsets.definition: Recognition within the ayllu (community) that maintains reciprocal balance without creating ayni obligations
synsets.cultural_note: Quechua concept of social presence that doesn't disrupt the delicate balance of community reciprocity and mutual aid

synsets.definition: Recognition within the tiospaye (extended family) that maintains harmony without invoking special responsibilities to the seven generations
synsets.cultural_note: Lakota concept of neutral acknowledgment that doesn't activate kinship obligations or spiritual responsibilities

synsets.definition: Social recognition within the kehillah (community) that doesn't invoke tikkun olam responsibilities or special covenant obligations
synsets.cultural_note: Hebrew concept of ordinary community standing that doesn't activate deeper spiritual or communal repair obligations

synsets.definition: Recognition that maintains one's place in the social order without affecting namus (family honor) or creating misafirperverlik obligations
synsets.cultural_note: Turkish concept operating within honor-hospitality systems without triggering family reputation concerns

synsets.definition: Social recognition that functions within adat (customary law) without requiring budi (reciprocal kindness) activation
synsets.cultural_note: Malay concept of acknowledgment that operates within traditional customs without creating reciprocal obligations

synsets.definition: Recognition within the samaj (society) that doesn't affect family izzat (honor) or invoke adab (proper conduct) expectations
synsets.cultural_note: Bengali concept of social acknowledgment that doesn't impact complex family honor systems or behavioral expectations

synsets.definition: Recognition that exists within tehzeeb (refined culture) norms without affecting izzat or requiring special adab
synsets.cultural_note: Urdu concept operating within sophisticated cultural refinement systems without triggering honor or etiquette protocols

synsets.definition: Social acknowledgment within the business-community network that doesn't affect reputation or create relationship obligations
synsets.cultural_note: Gujarati concept functioning within merchant community dynamics without impacting business relationships or social capital

synsets.definition: Recognition within the community that maintains kula (family lineage) neutrality without invoking dharmic responsibilities
synsets.cultural_note: Tamil concept of acknowledgment that doesn't disturb ancient family honor systems or dharmic obligations

synsets.definition: Community recognition that exists within traditional hierarchies without affecting varna-related expectations or duties
synsets.cultural_note: Kannada concept operating within traditional social stratification without activating caste-related obligations or judgments

synsets.definition: Acknowledgment within the community that doesn't affect family's social position or invoke hospitality obligations
synsets.cultural_note: Punjabi concept of recognition that operates independently of family honor systems and legendary hospitality expectations

synsets.definition: Recognition within the herding community that maintains traditional relationships without affecting ancestral obligations or seasonal reciprocity
synsets.cultural_note: Mongolian concept of social acknowledgment that doesn't disturb traditional nomadic reciprocity systems or ancestral honor
